ygData.subject: For Alan
ygData.msgSnippet: Alan, I agree with you. Sometimes it seems those MOBS just hate the cleric no matter what. I really don t know if it s because the tank is not an effective
ygData.messageBody:
Alan,

I agree with you. Sometimes it seems those MOBS just hate the cleric no
matter what. I really don't know if it's because the tank is not an
effective taunter, or the cleric heals too soon, too much, or what. I'll
need more experience before I can determine that. I know that when I
dual wield, taunting the MOBS onto me becomes harder to do, because I'm
not doing as much short term damage. However, my experiences so far have
been with clerics who won't heal AT ALL, not with those who can't heal
because they're being hit by the MOBS. There's a big difference.

In all honesty, any tank who can't consistently get a mob off a cleric
is not doing his job well. He either doesn't taunt enough, or has
neglected his skill, or needs a better weapon that does more damage. At
level 19, I use a Langseaux of the Wolves in big groups, because I want
to be sure that I'm doing max damage. I can consistently hit for 29-32
each time I hit, and with crits up to 56, and a low charisma, those MOBS
really hate me. Which is exactly what I want them to do :)

Regards,

Llewellen Iowerth

-----Original Message-----
From: Alan Raboy [mailto:ARaboy@...]
Sent: Tuesday, November 16, 1999 1:09 PM
To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com
Subject: RE: [EQ-Clerics] Why do so many clerics think they're wizards?


From: "Alan Raboy" <ARaboy@...>

This is a problem I've had to contend with as well. Once my tank gets
below half HP
and I have to dump 2 or 3 heals on him (I'm lvl 13) the Mobs invariably
attack me.
I ask him to taunt them off me, and more often than not, get killed
because he either
can't or doesn't do it in time. I play with a good friend so when I
asked him about this
he says that he is taunting the mob constantly, but it won't leave me.
So, don't just assume
the warrior isn't doing HIS job. It seems the Mobs will stick with a
healer until he's dead
sometimes.

Just my 2 cents.

>>> Chris Wheeler <wheelech@...> 11/16/99 02:02PM >>>
From: Chris Wheeler <wheelech@...>

Ok, hold on a second....

First put aside your self righteous "I know what i'm doing, but no one
else
does" attitude. Clerics don't hold a monopoly on stupidity in this
game.

Many times I have been grouped with higher level, higher HP tanks, and
have
been smoked because they don't know how to or don't know why they should
keep Mob's OFF OF THE HEALER!!!

I have a special macro just for these times, which broadcasts to my
group
that I have a MOB on me, and that no one gets healed till its off of me.

The primary responsibilty of a cleric is healing and buffing. Not
fighting.
However, if needs be, those smite and melee skills are there because
idiotic, barbarian warriors, like so many I've met, don't have an
inkling
about protecting healers.

-----Original Message-----
From: Perhaps a Princess... [mailto:sarah@...]
Sent: 1999/11/16 1:47 PM
To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com
Subject: RE: [EQ-Clerics] Why do so many clerics think they're wizards?


From: "Perhaps a Princess..." <sarah@...>

I don't know about soloing clerics, exactly. But I do know that I
play AGAINST solo clerics (Ie the orcs, etc that one runs into in
Oasis. These are effectively solo critters) The NPCs, when soloing,
do a LOT of nuking. So I think maybe that is what the nukes are
for!

But I do know about playing caster types that can't melee well (druid
and
enchanter)
It is not just frustrating to sit and med through a fight. It can also
get
to the point where you don't feel you are contributing to the group. It
might be useful to remind a cleric that feels they need to melee/nuke
every
fight they aren't directly healing that it is okay to sit out a fight,
med
ALL
the way through, and not fight at all. Even if they are not needed for
healing.
(We tend to pull blue meleers that my monk friend can handle all on her
own when I'm low on mana. Then I can sit and med throughout. But it
still
feels a little odd. As if I'm not doing my "part" -- It can be easy, at
level
18, to think I should still be meleeing. I haven't gotten to the part of
my life where I'm not effective yet. (And indeed, my AC is about the
same as
the monk's.
But she clearly does much more damage than I)

Anyway, you might want to humor your insecure clerics and such. let them
know that
they are STILL contributing even if they don't do ANYTHING in a
particular
battle.
Or maybe even a series of battles (if you're fighting a lot of blues.
Then
this
could even be possible) The cleric is still buffing, and being there,
ready
to
heal, and cure poison/disease if you happen to get hit by one of those.
And...

Faerain, level 18 Soldier of Tunare, Solusek Ro, Phoenix
